attributes.action: change legislation so that medical tests become compulsory for all drivers aged 70 years or over
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There will be a steady increase of drivers over the coming years with existing drivers maturing and growing older. 

We agree that experience counts towards making a capable driver but so do medical fitness, awareness and reaction times.  

We must concede that as we get older our faculties slow down and deteriorate. 

We request that legislation be drafted and enforced to make medical tests such as eye tests and reaction simulators for drivers over 70 years old compulsory. 

We have suffered the tragic loss of a dear friend Paulo Pereira due to several contributory factors including the physical limitations of the 94 year old driver involved. 

Given the forecasted statistics from the DVLA, there will be a greater number of elderly drivers on the road in years to come, as our population is ageing. The risk of further fatalities caused by unfit drivers aged 70 years or over will therefore increase. 

Medical testing MUST become written statute to prevent further tragedies such as Paulo’s from occurring.
